description: 1963 Studebaker Gran Turisimo Hawk  For 1963 the car was slightly restyled, with refinements to the front, sides, and rear. Round parking lights below the headlights replaced the previous rectangular ones, set into the corners of the newly closed side grilles that bore a squared pattern of lines over fine mesh. Beginning with the 1963 model year, the "Jet Thrust" R-series V-8 engines designed for the Avanti could be ordered throughout the Studebaker line, with the naturally aspirated R1 delivering 240 bhp.  This GT Hawk is finished in a deep red over a black and white interior. The chrome trim and grille are in excellent condition. The car featuers power steering and brakes, air conditioning, bucket sets and center console and a full set of gauges including tachometer.  It is powered by the 289 cu in V-8 and 3 speed automatic transmission.
title: 1963 Studebaker Hawk

description: 1963 Studebaker Avanti
Studebaker itself referred to the Avanti as "America's Only 4 Passenger High-Performance Personal Car!" And it definitely is; this Avanti is in great running condition and ready to be enjoyed.
A total of 4,643 Avantis were built during 18 months of production. The 1963 Avanti had round headlight surrounds, the 1964 models were square.
•	The 289 motor has 10.25:1 with a four-barrel carburetor producing 240 horsepower.
•	4 speed manual transmission
•	Factory Dual Exhaust
•	Power steering
•	Power front disc brakes
title: 1963 Studebaker Avanti

description: 1950 Studebaker Custom Truck. This truck started life as a plain Studebaker truck in 1950. After it was retired from daily driver duties, the previous owner purchased it in about 1988. It was then started on as show truck to compete in the NSRA, but after issues with the builder the previous owner lost intrest in it and it sat for 25 years in his warehouse. It was rescued 2 years ago. It was a roller with a lot of work to be done. The truck is as follows: Handbuilt square tube frame with all C4 Corvette suspension front and back. The body is chopped and and channeled and ALL STEEL. There is about 3 years of metal fabrication work in this truck.It has 1989 Mercedes 500 SL headlights and 1992 Dodge Stealth taillights. It has a 1992 Corvette LT1 that has been rebuilt. It has 400 turbo transmission with a 2500 stall convertor.It has suicide doors with no door handles(key fob poppers). Digital dash. Southern Rods HVAC. Chevrolet HHR seats. It has tilt steering, power door locks and power windows. It has a 15 gallon polyethylene fuel cell. It also has 2012 Camaro 18 inch wheels. The windshield is tint smoke color glass and the side and rear windows are cast acrylic also smoke color. been driving this truck once or twice a week for about a year now. It is not a daily driver howeverits been driven enough to get the majority of the bugs worked out.The air conditioning is completely installed but not charged. The digital dash works OK but the speedometer is not correct.  have all analog gauges to replace the digital dash if you prefer.  have receipts for everything purchased for this truck.  Also have all the LT1 wiring information.
title: 1950 Studebaker Custom

description: The 1963 STUDEBAKER GRAN TURISMO HAWK for sale here is a direct descendant of the Fabulous 1953 Loewy Coupe one of the most significant automobile designs of that decade Updated by Brooks Stevens, the powerful Hawk GT was one of the first personal luxury automobiles and was espoused in ads featuring famous connoisseur and Rolls-Royce Owner Lucius Beebe, former chairman of the Pebble Beach road races and author of the book "The Big Spenders". The GT Hawk achieved certified milestone car status long ago. With only a few thousand units built for 1963, It's a rare All-American Classic of the most desirable kind. This fantastic '63 STUDEBAKER GRAN TURISMO HAWK comes with an irrepressible 289 cubic inch solid lifter V-8 Power plant with Dual Exhaust. The Hawk's body is free of dings and dents original black with a pearl interior. All bright work and trim are in place throughout. The trunk is solid with the original spare the real nice original interior and seats all original! Dashboard is in unaltered factory condition. In addition to the engine work, there is a rebuilt transmission, a restored gas tank, new voltage regulator, fuel pump, brakes, restored radiator, rebuilt starter, new battery.
title: 1963 Studebaker Hawk

description: 1962 Studebaker Hawk Gran Turismo. Nice red this car has power steering and all new brakes and new shocks, the paint looks really nice and the interior does also. The tires are new. Drove this car home with no problems.
title: 1962 Studebaker Hawk

description: We are proud to offer this rare 1970 Studebaker Avanti 4 speed car for sale at Steel Dreamz.  Restored around 2008 it comes with a documented build book of all work performed.  This car features a straight, ding free body that received a new coat of the original red paint during the restoration.  The exterior is complemented by excellent chrome and trim including re-chromed bumpers, new weather seals, excellent glass with a brand new windshield, and new Magnum 500 wheels wrapped in Daytona white sidewall radial tires.  Underneath you will find a fully restored frame with new front and rear springs, new shock absorbers, all new bushings and new brake pads, shoes, lines and master cylinder. Inside is a new black vinyl bucket seat interior with factory console, Hurst 4 speed shifter, custom steering wheel, custom Avanti floor mats, aftermarket AM/FM/Cassette audio system and fully reconditioned switch gear.  All gauges appear as new. Under the hood is a freshly rebuilt Corvette small block V8 with all new internal parts, new belts and hoses, Cyclone aluminum intake manifold, Edelbrock carburetor, HEI ignition and cooled by an aluminum radiator with electric pusher fan.  This is all backed by a manual four speed transmission.  This car runs and drives like a dream.  For more information or to make an appointment to see it in person, give us a call today!
title: 1970 Studebaker Avanti

description: This investment quality Studebaker Lark has only 23,476 original miles.  It is as nice of an original car available anywhere. With a good history and obvious previous owner care, this car can be driven anywhere at any time.  It idles so smoothly that it is hard to tell that it is running.  It has highway manners, but it is maneuverable in town as well.  There are very few investment cars that offer the value that is available here in a car that can be used and enjoyed everyday or during special events. Parts availability is very good and the maintenance is simple. Here at Rallye Import Auto, we strive to offer only the nicest collector cars and late model European cars. Cars from The Rallye Collection at Rallye Import are sorted and serviced and are ready to enjoy from the first day!
title: 1960 Studebaker Lark

description: This is a 1 family owned, very dry car purchased new in Southern California. The GT Hawk's styling was a fairly radical face lift by designer Brooks Stevens of the older Hawk shape; Stevens went after a European-inspired, clean look for the car he code named the "Hawk Monaco" . This car features a 289 Packard V8 engine, a manual 3 speed on the column, AM/FM CD stereo, A/C upgraded with a late model compressor and R134 Freon, the interior has been redone to a tan leather that is flame retardant (the same material used in United airlines cockpits) and has been repainted red. This car runs and drives great!
title: 1962 Studebaker Hawk

description: 1962 Studebaker Lark. Has a straight 6 with a 3 speed on the tree and 72,000 original miles. This is a great driving car that I would drive anywhere. Has an electric choke carburetor that always starts up even in the winter. Has a good heater. I wouldn't be afraid to use this as a daily driver. It would make a great weekend cruiser or a cool cheap car for a High school student. Gets 20 plus mpg. This car turns a lot of heads and is very unique and strikes up conversation where ever it goes.
title: 1962 Studebaker Lark

description: Ultra rare and distinct, we already know you're attracted to this 1962 Studebaker Champ pickup.  But when you see how much was invested in giving this an extremely high quality full restoration (with everything from a more powerful V8 to a loaded A/C interior), you'll fall in love with this one-of-a-kind truck.

When you have spent this much time on a pickup it can be both industrial and striking at the same time.  That's why it's painted in Caltrans service vehicle orange.  Against the white grille, bumpers, and hubcaps, the bold color that pays tribute to its workman roots, but the moment the sunlight hits it, there is a vibrant luster that's worthy of the best car shows.  This is thanks to an investment in a full restoration that stripped this Studebaker down to its bare elements, and then built it back up with the best modern epoxy, urethane, and clearcoat procedures.  Excellent bodywork highlights the Lark-inspired front end that flows into a muscular bed design.  And speaking of the bed, the gloss applied over the new pine wood has the same deep luster as the expensive paintwork.  Why would someone invest this much in a pickup? Because beyond just its cool appearance, this is a very rare machine.  It's believed Studebaker produced less than 9,000 consumer pickups across the entire line in 1962, and over half a century later, the survivors are few and far between.  So, to have it finished to at this level means you know you're looking at a very unique truck.

Inside the exterior orange returns as part of an intriguing mix of classing and modern worlds.  It starts with the custom bench seat that has cloth inserts for individual comfort. These houndstooth pieces almost feel like you're about to get into a classic Camaro.  All the right vintage pieces are there from the Studebaker steering wheel to the AM radio â€“ there are even Studebaker seat belts! But there are a lot of hidden elements that you'll really love.  Open the middle compartment and it reveals the modern AM/FM/CD stereo with satellite radio, Bluetooth, and an aux input.  Plus the cab is sealed with Acousti-Mat, which not only keeps the exterior noise at bay, but also it provides insulation to allow the air conditioning unit to keep you ice-cold in the summer.

When you open the hood, you can really tell that they left plenty in the restoration budget for the engine bay.  The 289 cubic-inch V8 was the top motor for the Champ in '62, but this one here actually comes from a Studebaker President.  So it has earned the extra flair on places like the valve covers.  Plus, the President donated its automatic transmission, too, for the ultimate in comfort motoring.  This V8 inhales through a four-barrel carburetor for nice power, and you also get a muscular rhythm out of the dual exhaust.  But don't just listen to the burly tone; see where it comes from in the undercarriage photos.  That's where you're going to see such a spotless finish, which tells you the level of investment in this pickup.  But as beautiful as the total package is, there is still a practical side.   You might have noticed the trailer hitch on the rear, and the trailer brake control in the interior.  So now you know you can use the powerful V8 for genuine truck duty.

Just imagine all the fun you can have with this pickup â€“ everything from towing your vintage boat to showing it off (and with the quality, probably winning) all on it's own. It comes with a full restoration photo file so you can take others on the journey of creating this very cool Studebaker.  But you can only do it all if you're quick enough to grab this one-of-a-kind.  Call now!!
title: 1962 Studebaker Champion

description: For sale in our Orlando Florida showroom is a 1964  Studebaker Champ Pickup. The Studebaker Champ was a light-duty pickup truck produced by the Studebaker Corporation from 1960-1964. The chassis and cargo box of the Champ were basically the same as what had been used for Studebaker's Ã‚Â½ and Ã‚Â¾-ton trucks since 1949, but the cab section was very different. An entirely new cab was out of the question because of cost considerations, but the new Lark compact car's body proved to be just the right size and shape to suit the purpose. The engineering staff took a four-door sedan, cut it in half behind the front doors and modified the front half slightly to fit the truck chassis. The only new sheetmetal stamping that was required was the back wall of the new cab. Minor modifications for mounting of the cab to the 1949-vintage truck frame were also made.The Lark's front end sheetmetal was retained as well, but funds were allocated to give the Champ a new horizontal-bar grille that delivered a "tougher" look From the start of production, those desiring V8 power could choose between Studebaker's 259- and 289 inÃ‚Â³ engines with either a two- or four-barrel carburetor. Both engines remained largely unchanged during the truck's production run. A wide variety of transmissions, both manual and automatic, were available in Champs. Base models came with a three-speed column shifted manual (AKA: 3 on the tree). Today, the Champs that still exist are highly prized for their interesting combination of passenger-car comfort and style and their rugged mechanical durability For more HD pictures and video visit http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1964/studebaker/champ-S719.htmll. For more information about this truck call our Orlando Florida Showroom at 407-771-2000.or email us at Orlando@gatewayclassiccars.com - See more at: http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1964/studebaker/champ-S719.html
title: 1964 Studebaker Champion

description: Beautiful low original mileage Studebaker Avanti II S
Very rare ONE (1) of 188 total built !!
Avanti II V-8 305 automatic, model year 1982, version for North America U.S.
2-door coupe body type
RWD (rear-wheel drive), automatic 3-speed gearbox
petrol (gasoline) engine with displacement: 5001 cm3 / 305.2 cui, advertised power: 112 kW / 150 hp / 152 PS ( SAE net ), torque: 325 Nm / 240 lb-ft
characteristic dimensions: outside length: 4905 mm / 193.1 in, wheelbase: 2769 mm / 109 in
reference weights: base curb weight: 1680 kg / 3704 lbs

The Avanti II is an American performance sports coupe based on the Studebaker Avanti and marketed through a succession of five different ownership arrangements subsequent to Studebaker's discontinuation of the model.

Our's has the original fiberglass body beautifully dressed in silver metallic with red leather interior. Beautiful condition front and rear chrome bumpers and chromed door handles. Nice original interior showing as expected for her age, factory spoke wheels in very good condition,power moon roof, chevy 305 V8 ,auto transmission, factory air that works and the vehicles runs and drives well.

This car is a real piece of auto history kept alive by the dreams of numerous entrepreneur owners. You can share in their dream right now.                                                                      Must See!!!
